quizzes.question: What is the name of the function that converts the text to lowercase?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The UPPER Function[/h1]

The [b]UPPER [/b]function converts all letters in the specified string to uppercase. 
The [b]LOWER [/b]function converts the string to lowercase.

The following SQL query selects all [i]LastNames [/i]as uppercase: [code format="sql"]SELECT FirstName, [b]UPPER(LastName)[/b] AS LastName 
FROM employees;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2822" width="100%"]
[note]If there are characters in the string that are not letters, this function will have no effect on them.[/note]

quizzes.textContent:
[h1]SQRT and AVG[/h1]

The [b]SQRT[/b] function returns the square root of given value in the argument.

Let's calculate the square root of each Salary:[code format="sql"]SELECT Salary, [b]SQRT(Salary)[/b] 
FROM employees;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2823" width="100%"]
Similarly, the [b]AVG[/b] function returns the average value of a numeric column: [code format="sql"]SELECT [b]AVG(Salary) [/b]FROM employees;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2824" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: Type in the aggregate function name used to calculate the sum of a column's values.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The SUM function[/h1]

The [b]SUM [/b]function is used to calculate the sum for a column's values
  
For example, to get the sum of all of the salaries in the employees table, our SQL query would look like this: [code format="sql"]SELECT [b]SUM(Salary)[/b] FROM employees;[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2825" width="100%"]
[note]The sum of all of the employees' salaries is 31000.[/note]
